snippet: The city and a big creditor asked a judge on Tuesday to cut short planned testimony so they could keep negotiating toward a settlement that might protect a prized public art collection.
abstract: Thomas F Cullen Jr, lawyer representing Detroit, tells Judge Steven W Rhodes of United States Bankruptcy Court for the Eastern District of Michigan that city is close to deal with Financial Guaranty Insurance Company, last major holdout creditor; Financial Guaranty confirms possible settlement, which could preserve public art collection, but neither side provides specifics.
lead_paragraph: The city and a big creditor asked a judge on Tuesday to cut short planned testimony so they could keep negotiating toward a settlement that might protect a prized public art collection.

headline.main: Deal Is Said to Be Close in Detroit’s Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Deal Is Said to Be Close in Detroit’s Bankruptcy
